name: Carrots
properties: Rich in vitamin A and beta-carotene(beta-cryptoxanthin), both fight inflammation and reduce the risk of developing arthritis.

name: Celery
properties: It contains antioxidants and polysaccharides that act as anti-inflammatories, especially flavonoid and polyphenols. Phenolic acids such as caffeic acid and ferulic acid, as well as flavanols such as quercetin.

name: Pineapple
properties: Pineapple is rich in vitamin C and the enzyme bromelain, linked to decreased pain and swelling in both osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.

name: Orange
properties: Rich in vitamin C and getting the right amount of vitamin aids in preventing inflammatory arthritis and maintaining healthy joints with osteoarthritis (OA).

name: Turmeric
properties: Tumeric contains curcumin that is beneficial in the management of the chronic inflammatory-related joint disease.

name: Fish
properties: Fish contains inflammation-fighting omega-3 fatty acids. Omega-3-rich fish include salmon, tuna, mackerel, and herring.

name: Garlic
properties: The compound diallyl disulphine found in garlic may limit cartilage-damaging enzymes in human cells.

name: Broccoli
properties: Broccoli has been associated with reduced inflammation. It also contains sulforaphane, which may have anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Ginger
properties: Ginger reduce symptoms of arthritis. It may decrease inflammation.

name: Spinach
properties: Spinach is rich in antioxidants, including kaempferol. Kaempferol can reduce inflammation and slow the progression of osteoarthritis.

name: Walnut
properties: Walnuts are high in omega-3 fatty acids, which could alleviate arthritis symptoms as well as inflammation.
